definitionCn: 中枢神经系统相对常见的肿瘤来自蛛网膜细胞。大多数是分化良好的血管肿瘤,虽然发生恶性亚型,但其生长缓慢并且具有较低的侵袭性。脑膜瘤偏好从旁矢状区域,大脑凸面,蝶形脊,嗅沟和脊柱后凸。
definitionEn: A relatively common neoplasm of the CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM that arises from arachnoidal cells. The majority are well differentiated vascular tumors which grow slowly and have a low potential to be invasive, although malignant subtypes occur. Meningiomas have a predilection to arise from the parasagittal region, cerebral convexity, sphenoidal ridge, olfactory groove, and SPINAL CANAL.

name: SolitaryFibrousTumour/Haemangiopericytoma
孤立性纤维性肿瘤/血管外皮细胞瘤

MRIImageDescription:
Secretory meningiomas are similar to other more common types of meningioma in morphology (e.g. they usually have a discernable dural tail). They do, however, differ from meningothelial meningiomas and fibrous meningiomas (the most common histological variants) in their signal intensity, and in the fact that secretory meningiomas very frequently have prominent adjacent parenchymal oedema. Signal intensity
The typical MRI signal intensity of secretory meningiomas is: T1: iso- to hypointense to grey matter
T2 / FLAIR: hyperintense to grey matter
T1 C+: vivid homogeneous enhancement
